lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after Tony Stack's intelligent personal assistant Jarvis. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Jarvis.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Jarvis.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Jarvis Level-3 is an intelligent chatbot that helps you keep track of things by storing the items you typed, listing them back to you on request,
and letting you designate tasks as done/undone.
Run the app (`Jarvis.java`), then type commands into the terminal as standard input.
## Below are what you can ask Jarvis Level-3 to do
Type any text that is not `list` or `bye` to store it.
Use `list` to ask Jarvis Level-3 to show all stored items, numbered from `INDEX` 1.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Use `mark INDEX` to mark the task at `INDEX` as done.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
### Mark a task as not done
Use `unmark INDEX` to mark the task at `INDEX` as not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
- Items are stored in memory only (they are not saved to disk).
- Maximum number of stored items is 100.
* Runs Jarvis Level-3, an intelligent chatbot that stores user-specified tasks, lists them back as requested, and marks tasks as done/undone.
* Starts Jarvis Level-3, reads commands from standard input, stores entered tasks, lists it on {list},
* marks tasks on {mark <index>} / {unmark <index>}, and exits on {bye}.
System.out.println(" I am your super-intelligent friend.");
System.out.println(" What can I do for you?");
System.out.println(" Tell me what's in your mind and I will echo back to you.");
System.out.println(" Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
System.out.println(" Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println(" Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
System.out.println(" Please enter a valid task number.");
System.out.println(" OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
System.out.println(" Please enter a valid task number.");
System.out.println(" Sorry, I can only store " + MAX_TASKS + " tasks.");
private static boolean isValidTaskNumber(int taskNumber, int taskCount) {
* A class to represent a task with a description and a completion status.
* Creates a task with the given description.
* Returns the completion marker for this task.
* Marks this task as not done.
